citation.article-title: Methylogaea oryzae gen. nov., sp. nov., a mesophilic methanotroph isolated from a rice paddy field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methylogaea oryzae sp. nov.
Methylogaea oryzae (o.ry′za.e. L. fem. n. Oryza genus name of rice; L. gen. n. oryzae of rice, referring to the isolation of the type strain from a flooded rice field).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Grows on nitrate, ammonia, urea, lysine, peptone and yeast extract as sole nitrogen sources.
Optimum growth occurs at 30–35 °C and at pH 7.
The type strain, E10T ( = JCM 16910T = DSM 23452T), was isolated from a rice paddy field located in Treinta y Tres, Uruguay.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.1 mol%.
